analysis.narrative:
ðŸ“Š **Consensus:** Market sentiment is decidedly BULLISH with MEDIUM-HIGH conviction across the majority of sources. Large-cap tech and AI momentum are driving all-time highs, though breadth concerns (mid-cap weakness) and fundamental disconnects (earnings guidance cuts vs. bullish headlines) temper conviction. Near-term upside is more probable than downside, but rally quality is narrowing.

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** (1) AI sector dominance and large-cap tech strength as primary rally driver; (2) Fed rate-cut expectations and soft-landing narrative supporting risk-on positioning; (3) Breadth divergence (large-cap strength vs. mid-cap selling) signaling potential low-conviction rally; (4) Post-holiday liquidity normalization as a tactical wildcard; (5) Earnings guidance reliability as a near-term credibility test for sustained upside.

ðŸŽ¯ **Levels:** SPY ($690.08): Call Wall $700 (146k OI - ACTIVE, 1.4% away), Put Wall $640 (153k OI - DORMANT, 7.3% away). Max Pain $687. Near support: $670 (45k OI - ACTIVE, 2.9% away), $645 (126k OI - DORMANT, 6.5% away). QQQ ($624.21): Call Wall $630 (33k OI - ACTIVE, 0.9% away), Put Wall $590 (164k OI - DORMANT, 5.5% away). Max Pain $620. Near support: $585 (137k OI - DORMANT, 6.3% away), $640 (31k OI - ACTIVE, 2.5% away). /ES: Progression targets 6940-6960-6970-7000 per Twitter analysis.
key_themes: AI sector momentum and large-cap tech dominance
Fed rate-cut expectations and soft-landing narrative
Breadth divergence: large-cap strength vs. mid-cap weakness
Earnings guidance credibility test for fundamentals
Post-holiday liquidity normalization and low-volume volatility risk
risk_factors: Narrow breadth (mid-cap selloffs despite large-cap highs) signals low-conviction rally vulnerable to rotation
Earnings guidance cuts in fintech, software, and pharma contradict bullish sentimentâ€”Q1 earnings season credibility test looms

analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: $700 call wall (active resistance, 1.4% away), $670 support (active hedging). QQQ: $630 call wall (active resistance, 0.9% away), $640 resistance also active (2.5% away). Watch for rotation or momentum exhaustion if SPY rejects $700 or QQQ fails to break $625-630 zone decisively.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Target progression toward $750-$760 (dormant call wall at $750, 8.7% away) if $700 breaks. Support backstops at $670 (active, 2.9% away) and $645 (dormant, 6.5% away). QQQ: Target $640-$645 if current resistance breaks; support at $590 (dormant, 5.5% away). Max Pain gravitational pull ($687 SPY, $620 QQQ) provides intermediate anchors through expiration.
